definitions.text: a large piece of fabric (usually canvas fabric) by means of which wind is used to propel a sailing vessel
an ocean trip taken for pleasure
any structure that resembles a sail
traverse or travel on (a body of water)
examples: He sailed the Pacific all alone

definitions.text: move with sweeping, effortless, gliding motions
examples: The diva swept into the room
Shreds of paper sailed through the air
The searchlights swept across the sky

definitions.text: travel on water propelled by wind
examples: I love sailing, especially on the open sea

definitions.text: travel on water propelled by wind or by other means
examples: The QE2 will sail to Southampton tomorrow
